metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29573 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
sysdeps/i386/ldbl2mpn.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before2.23 on x86 targets has a stack-based buffer overflow if the input to anyof the printf family of functions is an 80-bit long double with anon-canonical bit pattern, as seen when passing a\x00\x04\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x04 value to sprintf. NOTE: the issuedoes not affect glibc by default in 2016 or later (i.e., 2.23 or later)because of commits made in 2015 for inlining of C99 math functions throughuse of GCC built-ins. In other words, the reference to 2.23 is intentionaldespite the mention of "Fixed for glibc 2.33" in the 26649 reference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc-bin - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6 - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6-amd64 - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6-i386 - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6-prof - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6-s390 - 2.32-0ubuntu5
libc6-x32 - 2.32-0ubuntu5
locales - 2.32-0ubuntu5
locales-all - 2.32-0ubuntu5
nscd - 2.32-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.32-0ubuntu5').
